title: Smartsizing and Pre-defined Resolution
author: MerlinDWiz
body_snippet:
I sometimes work on a laptop with very small screen and RDP to certain computer for operations that require more "screen space".

So normally I do it with a RDP setting files by setting the resolution to higher than my laptop (1920 x1080) and enable smart sizing - which allow more "working space" without having to use the scroll bars to see parts of the screen in the RDP session.

The specific parameters are as follows:

desktopwidth:i:1920
desktopheight:i:1080
smart sizing:i:1

Hi VShawn,

My laptop's screen is tiny with resolution 1366 x 768 and running a remote session of 1600 x 900 reasonably comfortably.  Sometimes I use 1920 x 1080, that is probably pushing things a bit, but it is workable and the "extra space" is very convenient.

It really depends on the screen you are physically working on, which is why I suggested separating the field into 2 separate fields.
